title: @Riot - Why is Ahri allowed to stay at a consistent 54% winrate throughout the season?
body:
{{champion:103}} Real question. I'd like to know why an overly mobile champion with great assassination potential is allowed to stay at such a high winrate throught the entire season without ever getting looked at. Her pickrate ain't too shabby, either. **No matter how many casuals pick her up, she continues to perform in an overwhelming fashion**. Don't you think there might be something problematic about that?

Ahri is the most popular ap midlaner in the game, and that for a good reason. **Her gameplay leaves little risk for her while offering huge rewards once she lands one of her skillshots**, all thanks to the extremely generous safety nets you've given her (her sheer mobility) which makes it almost impossible to even gank her in lane. She also gets free movespeed for merely casting one of her abilities without having to hit her target(s) unlike certain other champions ({{champion:69}}).

**The last nerf to her sustain didn't do anything to reduce her effectiveness, she remains as strong as ever.** So why haven't you considered any real changes to her gameplay yet? Could this be due to the recent release of yet another Ahri skin or do you simply fear upsetting her playerbase? Please respond.

replies.body:
Because she isn't outright toxic to play against. She's safe, easy to play, and effective at what she does, but playing against her doesn't make you want to punch a wall like other champions with overloaded kits and/or gimmicky mechanics, her numbers have been too high at various points in time but her kit as a whole is well designed. If anything she feels like one of the more fair champs to lane against.

Other champs like {{champion:7}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:8}} get nerfed when they are remotely viable because the experience of fighting against them is opposite of what you play a videogame for, their playstyle is obnoxious at best and oppressive at worst and no one wants to see them in games.

Ahri can be allowed to be strong in the right hands because every lane matchup she has is purely skill based. Many midlaners can poke with 2+ abilities and combo, while Ahri only has an easy to dodge skillshot. Not to mention she is easy to harass out of lane. She has no kill pressure before lvl 6, and even when she does get her ult it is still quite easy to dodge her skillshots. I don't quite understand why people join the Ahri hate train. Heimerdinger has always had a higher win rate and no one really cares about him. Not that Heimer is op, its just an example.

I find it extremely frustrating to play against her as any assassin or skill-shot based champions. Having 3 dashes on her ult as well as a speed boost makes her exceptionally mobile, and it's very difficult to dodge an ult-dash into E combo if the Ahri knows what she's doing. She's frustrating to me because unless you have insane burst and hard cc (so anyone but annie) you can't ever really kill her.

Also, just as a note, I think that Darius is a lot more balanceable with the new rework. Delay on his Q and his E being "bug fixed" makes him very easy to outplay. Pity that no one seems to want to.

Agreed. I don't mind Ahri being strong because I feel I have a chance to win with whoever I use and doesn't have much innate BS. For example, Heimer could be the most balanced champ in the world with a 1% win rate and I'd still yell bloody murder just facing him

That's why it's a percentage. It doesn't matter if its 50% out of 200 or 200000 games. It's still 50%.

The general reasoning people put behind the claim about winrate + pickrate is that high pickrate must mean that the champion has a lot of players new the champion playing it. And therefore, if it also has a high winrate it means even noobs can do well with the champion, which of course means its overpowered. It does not make any sense. Rather, champion.gg has the actual statistic average number of games played by player per champ. Ahri's is average.
If you're talking about champion.gg, even people new to Ahri have >50% winrates with her. She's overpowered.
The same way Gnar is underpowered, amirite?

Gnar probably is underpowered in yolo Q. I mean, I hate him and all the ranged manaless toplaner shit they put on Mini Gnar, but the statistics speak for themselves.

Personally, if I had to change him I'd put a much bigger focus on him staying in Mega Gnar form, instead of transforming, jumping on people, and getting his burst/CC combo off. He'd stay in Mega form much longer, have slightly weaker skills, and would be somewhat tankier in exchange for nerfing Mini Gnar and making it an actual weakness for him in lane.

I can assure you the number of champions that are strong competitively but have low winrates don't end with him. But you acknowledge that's soloQ, right? Competitively speaking, Ahri has about a 13% pick/ban in LCS last I saw, having won 5 games of 9. Not 0%, but she's clearly not a favored pick at the highest level of play.

But yes, at soloQ the data says she's overpowered. But then, there are several champions which are higher than her at soloQ as well. Especially in the hands of experienced players, Ahri's winrate is 56% which isn't terribly high. You can see champions like Talon and Twisted Fate also have that >50% winrate for new players and over 57% on experienced.

I'm not exactly saying I'd be sad to see nerfs for TF or Talon (or Heimer, that piece of shit) either.

You're correct that solo Q statistics don't necessarily translate well over to competitive, but there are things to be said for champs not just dominating it even if they're unseen in competitive play either (e.g. Kat)

54% winrate is hardly dominating either. This statistic alone is not indicative of imbalance. She's popular but she also has the lowest banrate of champions that are considered good this meta, and for a good reason. She simply isn't very oppressive and you can outplay her relatively easily.

Being easy to learn and popular does not make a champion nerf worthy.

No, but being the single most popular midlane champion with a ricockulous winrate _is._

And let's be seriously here. 54% is definitely dominating.

Lux has a ~56% winrate with 10% play rate. Why don't you go QQ about her too? She is only played only 7% less than Ahri. Winrates and Play percent define how "overpowered" the champion is you know, not factors like the direction of the meta, or other indirect changes or anything kappa.

...This isn't a topic about Lux. But since you're going to go ahead and be a dishonest wonk in this manner anyways, yes, I believe Lux deserves nerfs.

Hell, I believe she didn't deserve buffs in the first place.

54% is very much within the boundaries of balance. You will never have a game in a state of everything being 50% but winrates of 46% and 54% as the biggest outliers is considered fine. 

What does being one of the most popular midlaners but having one of the lowest banrates of any champion considered meta tell you. She isn't even in the top 4 of most banned mids, Azir, Viktor, Dianna, and Fizz have higher banrates. 

She doesn't have an obscene winrate and players don't think her kit is toxic or strong enough that's worthy of being banned despite how often she is seen. I don't really see any grounds for nerfing her tbh.

Ahri feels too safe.  Ganking her is borderline impossible.  Poking her down is way harder than you would think because of her sustain (even after the nerf).  You can't all in her unless she wants to go all in, because her ult is pretty much an automatic escape mid lane.  On top of all of this, if you get hit by a charm she can all in you and burst you down no matter how far away she is when the charm lands.  Oh, did I mention she has true damage to hurt tanks?

One of the issues she has is, combined with the MS boosts, is the fact that she builds Luden's practically first or second item. +10% MS is a tad radical for an item that's basically core/necessary for a lot of somewhat mobile mid lanes to power-house through the game with 800 AP (let alone Luden's next burst), and Ahri isn't an outlier for that...But in reality, the Q MS boost should've never been added. Her Q's cooldown is ridiculously low/spammable basically AND it gives speed? Infact, all of her cds are pretty low outside of her charm.

Her Q MS boost is basically the only buff she's gotten with the removal of DFG, which was her compensation buff. Otherwise, Q mana costs more, W range nerf, a shift of power from charm damage amp to charm base and scaling damage, ult nerf, and passive nerf.

This right here. Ahri, as a champion, has traditionally been an incredibly popular one - not just for her strong kit. You can observe a slew of conditional buffs that have managed to keep her meta relevant since her release, with the occasional tapping down when she gets a little too high. 

The core of her kit right now is the poster child for midlane assassins and uniquely among those that can deal with tanks/juggernauts. Changing that would knock her right out of her seat, similar to Kassadin's problem. You would have to talk about changing her CC, true damage, and foxfire/dash mechanics in some way that reduces her projection capabilities. Unfortunately, doing so will probably remove her viability as picks like LeBlanc rocket past her.

Keep in mind, they were afraid to nerf Lee Sin for the same reasons. He's incredibly popular, to the point actually impacting him would significantly affect their player base. They went on record to state as much. I can imagine the same situation applying here.

R = It doesn't prioritize champions, but can only with one target. So 2 creeps and one champion? Free hit with a dash.

You go all in because you are fed up with the pokes? She will burst you OR she will run away while taking away half of your life =D.

It is a kit with no weakness. Sure, you can say mana cost but a doran ring during lane phase and blues after that and there is no weakness.

The Q ms buff gives saves her R for escaping or an all in. It would be good if ahri uses her R so it is wasted if she makes a bad decision.

Denying her CS and punishing her for trying to farm hurts her a lot. It reduces her overall sustainability by a large margin. And the belief that Morello's gives enough mana regen to spam everything is nothing but a myth. If she was building Athene's it would be believable.

Athene's has the same amount of base mana regen and CDR, 2% missing per 5, and 30% mana back if she gets a kill or assist. Plus a nice little bit of MR to help. With a difference of 20 AP and 400 gold.

Ahri's mana regen without Morello's: 6 - 19.6 (Lvl 1-18) Ahri's mana regen with Morello's: 12 - 39.2 (Lvl 1-18) Ahri's mana regen with Morello's and Doran's: 15 - 42.2 per 5.

This means that at lvl 18, Morello's gives 10.8 too little per 5 for her foxfires which cost 50 mana (Which are on a 5 second CD at level 5) And with Doran's the mana regen still isn't enough.

Ahri's base mana pool: 334 – 1184

Unless she buys more mana regen items other than Morello, builds flat mana or Athene's, she'll run out of mana rather quickly if she tries to spam poke at you.

Orb Costs: 65 / 70 / 75 / 80 / 85 (7S CD)

Foxfires Cost: 50 (9/8/7/6/5S CD)

Charm Cos: 85 (12S CD)

Foxy-triple-dash-whatever-it's-called Cost: 100 (110/95/80S CD)

Morello's doesn't cut it for the mana needed to sustain, so it means she's getting a lot of mana from elsewhere. And she is. CS. 4 mana per minion may not seem like much, but it stacks up fast when added to her mana regen. That's a potential 24 mana per cannon-less wave, 28 if cannon is included.

Though that 24 - 28 isn't much in the late game, it the early to mid it means a lot. She's getting gold and the mana needed to poke you, by CSing. So to counterplay her, deny her as much CS as possible and punish all attempts at CSing to the best of your ability.

While this doesn't fix her being a little bit too safe, and I agree that she should get her MS boost from hitting people with her abilities instead of from just casting, it makes things a lot easier to deal with in lane.
Because you don't know how to pick {{champion:50}}  or {{champion:1}}  doesn't mean a champ should be nerfed.
